title: Anyone-Can-Spend Scripts
summary: The document discusses "Anyone-Can-Spend Scripts" in ErgoScript, which are the simplest form of ErgoScript and consist of a single boolean predicate that always evaluates to true. This means that any funds sent to the corresponding address can be spent by anyone. The document provides an example of such a script, `true && (false || true)`, which corresponds to the address `NwAyzZpF2KcXAGBJvPrAH`.

qa_pairs.question: What is the simplest form of ErgoScript?
What does the script `true` correspond to?
What can anyone do with funds sent to an anyone-can-spend script?
What is the address corresponding to the script `true && (false || true)`?
What are scripts that consistently evaluate to `true` and their corresponding boxes called?

sections.heading: Anyone-Can-Spend Scripts
sections.content:
The simplest form of ErgoScript is a single boolean predicate. For example, `true` corresponds to the address [4MQyML64GnzMxZgm](https://wallet.plutomonkey.com/p2s/?source=dHJ1ZQ==) `4MQyML64GnzMxZgm`.

Any funds sent to this address can be spent by anyone, as the script always evaluates to `true`.

Scripts that consistently evaluate to `true`, and their corresponding boxes, are referred to as **anyone-can-spend** scripts.



```
true && (false || true)     // address NwAyzZpF2KcXAGBJvPrAH
```
